intro: Lagochilium maximilianum, commonly known as the Mexican flameflower, is a striking plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is typically shrub-like, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its showy flowers attract hummingbirds and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological value.
